content: A solution of Cu(NO3)2·(H2O)2.5 (0.124 g, 0.532 mmol) and H3BTC (0.074 g, 0.352 mmol) in the mixture of N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) (6 mL)/ethanol (6 mL)/H2O (6 mL) in a sealed vial (20 mL) at 70 °C for 24 h gave green, cubic microcrystalline crystals of HKUST-1 (120 mg) which were confirmed by a powder X-ray diffraction study. The as-synthesized HKUST-1 was exchanged with acetone 10 times (each of 20 mL) and then activated at 120 °C for 24 h under high vacuum up to 4 μmHg before BET and acetylene adsorption studies.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Synthesis of HKUST-1

A solution of Cu(NO3)2⋅(H2O)2.5 (0.124 g, 0.532 mmol) and H3BTC (0.074 g, 0.352 mmol) in the mixture of N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) (6 mL)/ethanol (6 mL)/H2O (6 mL) in a sealed vial (20 mL) at 70 °C for 24 h gave green, cubic microcrystalline crystals of HKUST-1 (120 mg) which were confirmed by a powder X-ray diffraction study. The as-synthesized HKUST-1 was exchanged with acetone 10 times (each of 20 mL) and then activated at 120 °C for 24 h under high vacuum up to 4 μmHg before BET and acetylene adsorption studies.
